intro: Leucopogon enervius, commonly known as the slender heath, is a flowering plant native to the coastal regions of southeastern Australia. It belongs to the family Ericaceae, which includes heaths and heather plants, and is characterized by its small, clustered flowers. The plant typically grows in sandy or gravelly soils and is adapted to coastal conditions, including salt spray and strong winds. Its leaves are narrow and evergreen, and the flowers are usually pink or white, appearing in late winter to early spring. Leucopogon enervius is often found in heathlands and is an important component of the local flora.
